medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral blurred and distorted vision for 4 weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 4 weeks prior to presentation, characterized by bilateral blurred and distorted vision, with central visual field objects changing shape and appearing disproportionately large or small. He also experienced intermittent flashes of light and altered color perception. Minimal right-sided periorbital headache was reported, with no history of diplopia, weakness, paresthesiae, numbness, or speech changes. Family noted episodes of confusion and anger recently.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prostate cancer treated with prostatectomy, Bell palsy at age 25, gastroesophageal reflux disease, bilateral refractive errors.
medical_history.social_history: The patient does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs. He is taking omeprazole.
